meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to efface the whiteboard after the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The rain will efface the footprints on the muddy path.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to efface the evidence of its digging in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Time has a way of effacing memories like an artist erasing a sketch.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind seemed to efface all traces of the sandcastle on the beach.

meanings.definition: To make oneself appear insignificant or inconspicuous
meanings.sent1: He always tried to efface himself in group photos by standing at the back.
meanings.sent2: The shy student would efface herself in class discussions.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon tried to efface itself by blending into the colorful background.
meanings.sent4: The ninja's ability to efface himself in the shadows amazed his enemies.
meanings.sent5: The humble leader would efface his own achievements to highlight his team's success.
